text: good morning guys I'm on my way to
Israel and Palestine over the next five
days I found a $70 one-way flight on
whizzer from Budapest to Tel Aviv can
you believe that Israel was the very
first country I visited overseas back in
2009 as a freshman in college
it's my homeland and it's surreal to be
back here eight years later with the
more mature mind and a completely new
perspective of the world I spent the
past two days exploring tel-aviv and
this is not how I remembered it at all I
guess I was too young and naive to
understand what was going on or the city
has tremendously evolved here are six
things I've realized about Tel Aviv
it's like European tel aviv feels like a
modern european city i had to keep
reminding myself that i left Europe and
I'm now in the Middle East
there's recycle bins all over the
streets not to mention trendy cafes
boutique hotels skyscrapers electric
cars I love it
Tel Aviv is young and wild the streets
are filled with galleries museums and
open-air cafes by nighttime the city
transforms into a vibrant scene with
tons of bars and nightclubs there's a
growing tech scene here for young
entrepreneurs and also it seems like
everyone has an electric scooter and a
large dog the coastline is amongst the
best we're walking now on the beautiful
boardwalk the Mediterranean beaches of
Tel Aviv are amongst the best I've ever
seen the beautiful boardwalk promenade
stretches 4 kilometers from north to
south with lots of activities going on
and you cannot miss the Sun setting over
the sea it lacks history Tel Aviv lacks
history because it was built from
scratch in 1909 most buildings here are
very modern and glamorous this is unlike
most other cities in Israel especially
Jerusalem which have been around for
millenniums it's a melting pot of
culture Tel Aviv is home to not only
Jews but a mix of Muslims Christians and
other influences who are all coexisting
together there's also a huge gay scene
here everyone I met was open-minded and
friendly and that's the beauty of Tel
Aviv falafel Fruit Chews and hummus
falafel fruit stands and hummus are
found everywhere which is amazing
because they're all my favorite snacks
to enjoy all day long pomegranate juice
in other words the cuisine is
outstanding we have tons of activities
playing over the next few days in both
Israel and Palestine and I can't wait to
bring you along for the ride
you
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
